definition: value/(to be) worth/to happen to/to be on duty

sentences.english: Our Tax programme provides an introduction to CGT on shares - we explain the basic principles of CGT calculations on the sale of shares by individuals.

sentences.english: The Ministry of Land and Resources has charged added-value fees for land reserves.

sentences.english: I wish to apply for Automatic Add Value Service for Supplementary Credit Cardholder.

sentences.english: Provide a framework for performing and promoting a broad range of value-added internal auditing.

sentences.english: Have you set up value-add packages?

sentences.english: At the same time, confirm the VAT payable.

sentences.english: In addition, the transfer of housing but also for value-added part of the paid income tax.

sentences.english: You have to take capital appreciation of the property into account.
sentences.chinese: 你必须将该处房产的资本增值考虑在内。

sentences.english: A the adoption of value-added tax reform and tax relief for the company.

sentences.english: Tomorrow is the world's fastest piece of land value, because it is rull of hope.

sentences.english: Or buy some land in an area with growth potential.
sentences.chinese: 或者在某个地区买一些有增值潜力的土地。

sentences.english: Value added tax shares duty for country and place, execute cent to become.

sentences.english: But they do not understand how a VAT works.
sentences.chinese: 但是他们并不理解增值税的运行原理。

sentences.english: Secondly, the introduction of land value increment tax.

sentences.english: The global gross value-added in the forestry sector is US$ 468 billion.
sentences.chinese: 全球林业部门增值总量为4680亿美元。
